ygData.subject: RE: EQ Slowly Dying?
ygData.msgSnippet: From what you say, I imagine that you have not played in any other universe. Let me tell you that compared to some other universes (and one comes to mind) EQ
ygData.messageBody:
From what you say, I imagine that you have not played in any other universe.
Let me tell you that compared to some other universes (and one comes to
mind) EQ is extremely well balanced and fun to play. No, in it you can not
get all the super gear at level 1. Thank the gods for that.

Personally, I give the game 3-4 years(at least). Ohh, I dont expect to see
the same number of people next year and the one after. Most likely there
will be a syphoning from other games but I dont see it as dying anytime
soon.

As for another comment somewhere else about Fennin being overcrowded. I play
on Cazic Thule and find it is fairly decent most places. There are a few
zones where all the jerks go to and I keep away from those. But there are
also some where people are extremely decent and helpful. What I have noticed
is that power gamers seem to generally belong to the first category.

Well, that was my 2cp worth. And now let me get my fire suit as protection
for my last paragraph <G>

Bidlok Halfling Cleric on Cazic Thule

-----Original Message-----
From: Jesse Anderton [mailto:tsedek50@...]
Sent: 10 septembre, 1999 13:20
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] EQ Slowly Dying?


From: "Jesse Anderton" <tsedek50@...>

The real shame about a game like EQ is that once it's gone no one can play
anymore. Guess it's one of the drawbacks to massively multiplayer games...

I hope it isn't dying any time soon.

Tsedek
Level 14 High Elf Cleric of Mithaniel Marr


>From: "John Erik Maynus" <jmaynus@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
>Subject: [EQ-Clerics] EQ Slowly Dying?
>Date: Thu, 9 Sep 1999 13:10:30 -0400
>
>From: "John Erik Maynus" <jmaynus@...>
>
>I've been reading on the EQ newsgroup that a good bit of ppl think EQ is
>already starting to die. Many are just bored of the game and are quiting
>or
>getting ready to, others are getting tired of Verant changing everything
>and
>some of it is for the worse. I've read where they are saying it's too late
>to save EQ, some even say even the new addon will not save it cause it'll
>still be the same game with just some new things. And yeah it might spice
>it up a bit, but for how long, I give it 3-4 months tops. After 3-4 months
>the power gamers will already have the extra lvls, everyone should have
>been
>in all the new zones, had a chance to play the new lizardman race. So once
>that happens it's gonna be right back to where it is now.
>Some are waiting for Asheron's Call and others are waiting for Middle-Earth
>to be released. Will AC or ME finish off EQ? I guess time will tell but
>since theres like 3-4 other RPGs coming out by the year 2000 I say one of
>them will put an end to EQ. And if EQ does die to fast it's no ones fault
>but Verants for not listening to the paying customers, they listen to a few
>but not the whole.
>Even tho EQ is a very good game it can't or won't be around forever.
>
>**************************
>Azor
>Lvl 18 Human Cleric of the Rathe
>**************************
>
